title: (x) Script Font Help / 'Buffalo' - lettering {Florian}
content:
Hi everyone. I'm looking for this script font or something pretty close.

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803041534/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_345.png) | 38.36 KB |
author: schmoopy.design

comments.content: Hm? Which script font? Where is your sample? The Featured Face is Elli by Font Bureau if that's the question …

Need help? [How to post a sample or image](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803041534/http:/typophile.com/node/18067)  
In particular, make sure that:

- the file name does not contain spaces (or any other ø∂∂ ¢håræct€rs)
- you have the right [Flash plugin](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803041534/http:/www.adobe.com/products/flashplayer/) installed with your browser
Sorry about that. Thanks for the link Florian.

Hi Barney,  
this is not a font, it’s lettering: note the differences in the 2 ‘f’s.  
You’ll find a lot of alternatives in Mike’s [Script ID Guide, pt. 7 Casual Flowing Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803041534/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg1.html). Or in the [Casual Brush Script FontList](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803041534/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/casual_brush_script/?&sample_text=Buffalo&sample_size=96&update=0).  
The ‘B’ might be the hardest detail to match.  
F
Thanks Florian. I had a feeling it might be hand lettered for that exact reason. I'm sure I'll find something close in the links you provided.
